newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee strengthens on dollar and pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee strengthens on dollar and pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee strengthened slightly against the dollar and the pound on Monday, commercial bank foreign exchange dealers said.
The rupee was quoted at a mean commercial rate of 20.1960 for one dollar from 20.2765 last Friday. The rupee traded at a mean of 33.2945 from 33.4040 on Friday.
Forex dealers said the stronger rupee against the dollar on Monday reflected central bank market interventions last week and the dollar's trend in overnight international markets.
The central bank sold dollars to commercial banks last Wednesday, Thursday and Friday at rates four to five cents lower than the prevailing interbank rates.
More hard currency arrived on Monday at commercial banks with a Mauritius Sugar Syndicate tender sale of pounds obtained from the Indian Ocean island's raw sugar exports.
Sugar exports are the largest hard currency earner for Mauritius in net value added terms.
